channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump and Netanyahu meet to discuss next phase of Gaza ceasefire plan
item.description: Israel's prime minister met President Trump at the White House Monday to discuss next steps in the peace plan with Gaza and across the region.
item.content:encoded: Israel's prime minister met President Trump at the White House Monday to discuss next steps in the peace plan with Gaza and across the region.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Former Israeli negotiator talks about the next phase of the Gaza peace plan
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks about the prospects for Phase Two of the Gaza peace plan with former Israeli negotiator Daniel Levy, president of the U.S./Middle East Project.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks about the prospects for Phase Two of the Gaza peace plan with former Israeli negotiator Daniel Levy, president of the U.S./Middle East Project.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: China conducting military drills around Taiwan, demonstrating blockade capabilities
item.description: China is conducting big military drills that encircle the island of Taiwan on Tuesday, demonstrating its ability to blockade Taiwan completely.
item.content:encoded: China is conducting big military drills that encircle the island of Taiwan on Tuesday, demonstrating its ability to blockade Taiwan completely.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Undercover documentary reveals Russia's propaganda efforts after invasion of Ukraine
item.description: "Mr. Nobody Against Putin," a film made secretly by a teacher in Russia, shows the propaganda efforts in a country at war.
item.content:encoded: "Mr. Nobody Against Putin," a film made secretly by a teacher in Russia, shows the propaganda efforts in a country at war.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Volunteers collect pine needles to help figure out how PFAS get into the environment
item.description: There's increasing concern about PFAS, the substances commonly called forever chemicals found throughout the environment. Now volunteers in Minnesota are collecting pine needles throughout the state in an effort to help researchers determine how PFAS find their way in water, soil, and air when there seems to be no obvious source
item.content:encoded: There's increasing concern about PFAS, the substances commonly called forever chemicals found throughout the environment. Now volunteers in Minnesota are collecting pine needles throughout the state in an effort to help researchers determine how PFAS find their way in water, soil, and air when there seems to be no obvious source
item.dc:creator: Kirsti Marohn

item.title: Thousands watch livestream of Maine family's food pantry for deer
item.description: A three-generation family in Maine set up a camera to capture their deer-feeding station. Thousands watch online as hundreds of white-tailed deer enjoy the food at Brownville's Food Pantry for Deer.
item.content:encoded: A three-generation family in Maine set up a camera to capture their deer-feeding station. Thousands watch online as hundreds of white-tailed deer enjoy the food at Brownville's Food Pantry for Deer.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of attempted drone strike, threatens to harden peace stance
item.description: Russia says Ukraine tried to hit one of Putin's homes with a drone. Kyiv denies it, calling the claim staged to justify war. The Kremlin now warns it may toughen its stance in the ongoing peace talks.
item.content:encoded: Russia says Ukraine tried to hit one of Putin's homes with a drone. Kyiv denies it, calling the claim staged to justify war. The Kremlin now warns it may toughen its stance in the ongoing peace talks.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump and Israel's prime minister discuss next phase of Gaza peace plan, Russia threatens to harden stance in peace talks after accusing Ukraine attempted strike, the impact of DOGE in 2025.
item.content:encoded: Trump and Israel's prime minister discuss next phase of Gaza peace plan, Russia threatens to harden stance in peace talks after accusing Ukraine attempted strike, the impact of DOGE in 2025.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: A professor breaks down Russia's negotiating tactics with Ukraine
item.description: Nina Khrushcheva, professor of International Affairs at New York's New School, talks about the negotiating tactics Russia is using in peace talks with Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: Nina Khrushcheva, professor of International Affairs at New York's New School, talks about the negotiating tactics Russia is using in peace talks with Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: More than a decade after its disappearance, Malaysia to resume search for MH370
item.description: Malaysia expects to resume its search for MH370, more than a decade after the plane vanished with 239 aboard. Its disappearance remains one of aviation's greatest mysteries.
item.content:encoded: Malaysia expects to resume its search for MH370, more than a decade after the plane vanished with 239 aboard. Its disappearance remains one of aviation's greatest mysteries.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Pak
